intro: Cytisus jankae f. pirinicus, commonly known as the Pirin Cytisus, is a rare flowering shrub native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late spring, adding a vibrant touch to the mountainous flora. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
